title: The suspension system is unfair.
body:
The current system that is used to moderate games is complete nonsense.

Not only is the system extremely abusive and exploitable, it frankly, just does not work. What happens with the system is punishing players who are innocent.

The reason why the system doesn't work - is because things are not handled like they should. Things should be handled on a case by case basis, There is no review by an actual person - It's an algorithm that bans people if they say bad words. This is insanity.

I just received a 14 day suspension where I was not being aggressive towards my teammates. Merely defending myself from their comments. But that doesn't matter. A human being does not look at the context of the game. A human being does not oversee the chat logs and see where my teammates are flaming me. All that matters is I was reported by a few members of my team because they wanted to punish me for my poor performance, and the system sees I called someone a moron, so I must be at fault.

Here is my chat log for the game I was banned for. Of course perhaps it looks vilifying without the context of the entire game. But that doesn't matter does it? 

Game 1
In-Game
Lord Gimli: ...
Lord Gimli: what are you doing?
Lord Gimli: gg bot
Lord Gimli: /all
Lord Gimli: btw karma throwin down some wards for mundo would be helpful
Lord Gimli: karma muted
Lord Gimli: you feed our lane 2 kills at start and then we get camped
Lord Gimli: and yet you decide to not gank our lane
Lord Gimli: rofl
Lord Gimli: starting w first is bad?
Lord Gimli: against an invade?
Lord Gimli: you hit level 2 on the 2nd wave
Lord Gimli: you're a moron
Lord Gimli: yeah, she's saying report me because i'm doing badf
Lord Gimli: i'm not being toxic, you call me an idiot for starting w
Lord Gimli: tell ya what sej
Lord Gimli: im gonna mute you
Lord Gimli: i understand i lost lane
Lord Gimli: but you guys had a major advantage
Lord Gimli: over us
Lord Gimli: and sej didnt help
Lord Gimli: yeah nice job
Lord Gimli: stealing farm from the adc
Lord Gimli: blitz
Lord Gimli: stop stealing farm
Lord Gimli: from the adc
Lord Gimli: do you want to lose?
Lord Gimli: sej keeps stealing my farm lol
Lord Gimli: i'm not being toxic
Lord Gimli: kayle im trying here
Lord Gimli: no
Lord Gimli: vote no
Lord Gimli: we can win
Lord Gimli: gg


This game I was flamed by my jungle and support the entirety of such. I merely defended myself throughout trying to win the game. However I am to be banned for 14 days for this behavior? Really?

This is garbage. We had a team member trolling and inting the entirety of the game, but that doesn't matter. The guy who says the moron word gets punished. BANS need to be reviewed by a person.

You feel the 14 day is unfair, but have you had previous punishments already? The verbal system is typically pretty fair due to the following:

1. Everyone reported gets reviewed for their own actions/behavior. (Doesn't matter what Bob did/said for your behavior).

2. 1 report does the same as 9. If a game is reported by just 1 person then the game is reviewed for that reported person. 

3. You won't be punished for actually defending yourself, which is muting; not retaliating.

Yea, I've been given chat restrictions before. And honestly, I've been trying to do much better because I wanted to avoid something like this. However, I honestly believe that my attitude and my word choice was not deserving of punishment here. I think the automated system is just broken.

1) Well that's a stupid system. That isn't how life works.

2) I've heard this before, but I don't believe it. The email riot sent me said " Players have reported you 7 times in the past 20 games for negative or abusive behaviors in chat". I refuse to believe that is 7 out of 20 games. I think it's 7 individual reports.

3) That's a good point. However, even though I muted some of my teammates, they can still report me. I'd also like to point out for some reason I can read muted teammate's messages in post game chat.

> 1) Well that's a stupid system. That isn't how life works.

This is not life, this is League. You are in Riot's living room, and they get to make the rules. Retaliation is against the rules. You aggravate the shit out of everyone else by having a flame war with one person. Mute the idiot and play the game.

> Obey or die.

Riot isn't the government, dude. If you don't like their policies, talk with your wallet and don't play their game.

You were passive aggressive, argumentative, and abusive towards teammates. It does not matter that "they started it" or "they were trolling and inting" or whatever. You don't get to break the rules just because they started it.

I understand your continuing loyalty to Riot may blind you from logical thought, however, I would suggest you take a moment to consider this -

The system is unfair. My words may appear passive aggressive, argumentative, or even abusive towards my teammates from your perspective. However, there is no context to the conversation because the entirety of the conversation is not there, which is heavily influencing your perspective.

I'm going to explain this with a very simple example.

A conversation between two people. 
> 
> Man 1: "Call me an Idiot."
> 
> Man 2: "You're an idiot."
> 


**Now let's remove the first man's words.**
> 
> Man 2: "You're an idiot."

Is it not obvious that there is a different light in the second example?  Obviously, this exact example is not what transcribed, however, my point stands. It is impossible to make a judgement of a conversation without the entirety of the discussion. It's fake news.

And to have a system that is designed around this, that is instantaneous, is completely horseradish. 

Have some compassion friend.
